name: Complete Compliant Note
visitNote:
HOME HEALTH VISIT NOTE

Date of Visit: January 15, 2026
Patient: John Smith, DOB: 03/15/1945
Visit Type: Skilled Nursing Visit

HOMEBOUND STATUS:
Patient is homebound due to severe mobility limitations secondary to bilateral knee osteoarthritis and chronic heart failure (NYHA Class III). Patient requires a walker and one-person assist to ambulate within the home. Leaving home requires considerable and taxing effort. Patient can only leave home for medical appointments and requires wheelchair transport. Patient becomes short of breath with minimal exertion and fatigues easily. Physician has documented homebound status and ordered home health services.

SKILLED NURSING SERVICES PROVIDED:
1. Wound care to left lower extremity venous stasis ulcer (3cm x 2cm x 0.5cm). Applied compression dressing per physician order. Wound shows signs of healing with decreased drainage.
2. Medication management and education for newly prescribed anticoagulant therapy. Patient instructed on signs/symptoms of bleeding to report.
3. Assessment of cardiovascular status including vital signs, lung sounds, and peripheral edema monitoring.
4. Blood glucose monitoring and diabetes management education.

PLAN OF CARE:
Continuing per physician orders dated January 10, 2026. Plan of care reviewed and signed by Dr. Johnson (NPI: 1234567890). Goals include wound healing, medication compliance, and disease management. Anticipated duration of services: 60 days with re-evaluation at 30 days.

FACE-TO-FACE ENCOUNTER:
Patient had face-to-face encounter with Dr. Johnson on January 8, 2026, who certified the need for home health services. Documentation of encounter on file. Physician certification statement completed and signed.

ASSESSMENT:
Patient tolerating care well. Vital signs stable: BP 128/78, HR 72, RR 18, O2 sat 96% on room air. Wound improving. Patient demonstrates understanding of medication regimen.

NEXT VISIT: January 18, 2026

Nurse Signature: Jane Doe, RN
Time in: 10:00 AM | Time out: 11:15 AM

Date of Visit: January 15, 2026
Patient: Mary Johnson, DOB: 07/22/1950
Visit Type: Skilled Nursing Visit

SKILLED NURSING SERVICES PROVIDED:
1. Wound care to right heel pressure ulcer. Applied hydrocolloid dressing per order. Wound measured at 2cm x 2cm x 0.3cm with healthy granulation tissue.
2. Medication reconciliation completed. Patient taking all medications as prescribed.
3. Vital signs monitored: BP 134/82, HR 76, RR 16, O2 sat 97%.

PLAN OF CARE:
Continuing per physician orders. Plan of care includes wound care three times weekly and medication management. Goals are wound closure and medication compliance.

FACE-TO-FACE ENCOUNTER:
Physician face-to-face encounter completed January 5, 2026 with Dr. Williams. Certification documentation on file.

ASSESSMENT:
Patient doing well. Wound showing improvement. Caregiver present and engaged in care plan.

Reinforced importance of pressure relief and proper nutrition for wound healing. Caregiver verbalized understanding.

Patient: Robert Williams, DOB: 11/30/1948

HOMEBOUND STATUS:
Patient is homebound due to severe COPD requiring supplemental oxygen 24/7. Patient cannot leave home without considerable effort and assistance. Uses wheelchair for any distance. Leaving home causes significant shortness of breath and fatigue. Patient only leaves for essential medical appointments.

SERVICES PROVIDED:
General assessment visit. Checked on patient comfort level. Patient reports feeling okay today. Assisted patient with activities of daily living. Reminded patient to take medications. Observed patient environment for safety hazards.

PLAN OF CARE:
Per physician orders. Patient to continue current regimen.

Physician encounter January 3, 2026. Home health ordered.

VITAL SIGNS:
BP 140/88, HR 82, RR 20, Temp 98.4F, O2 sat 92% on 2L NC

PATIENT CONDITION:
Stable. No acute distress. Patient comfortable at this time.

HOME HEALTH SKILLED NURSING VISIT

Date: January 15, 2026
Patient: Thomas Anderson, DOB: 05/08/1942

HOMEBOUND STATUS: Patient homebound due to weakness from recent hospitalization for pneumonia. Requires walker and assist x1 for ambulation. Leaving home is taxing. MD certified homebound.

SKILLED NURSING: Performed IV antibiotic administration (Ceftriaxone 1g IV daily per order). Assessed PICC line site - no signs of infection. Monitored for adverse reactions. Skilled assessment of respiratory status - lungs clear bilaterally, no distress.

VITALS: BP 126/74, HR 68, RR 16, Temp 98.2F, O2 sat 95% RA.

PLAN OF CARE: Per Dr. Chen orders dated January 12, 2026. IV antibiotics x7 days, skilled nursing 5x/week. Goals: Complete antibiotic course, monitor for complications.

FACE-TO-FACE: Dr. Chen F2F encounter January 12, 2026. Certification completed. Home health medically necessary.

ASSESSMENT: Patient improving. Tolerating antibiotics. Continue plan.

Next visit: January 16, 2026
